definition: stupid/sluggish/clumsy/to wiggle (of worms)/to move in a disorderly fashion

sentences.english: They are fools who adulate every decision of their leaders.
sentences.chinese: 對領導的每一個決定一味奉承的人們是蠢材。

sentences.english: Fools rush in where angels fear to tread .
sentences.chinese: 天使不敢踐踏的地方，蠢材蜂湧而至。

sentences.english: I would never call somebody a boob .
This is Hector, the fool who thought he killed Achilles.
sentences.chinese: 這就是赫克託，那個以爲自己打敗了阿基里斯的蠢材。

sentences.english: Believe me, I can fool that egghead.
sentences.chinese: 信我啦，我可以呃到個蠢材。

sentences.english: How on earth did a stupid guy like you make so much money?
sentences.chinese: 像你這樣的蠢材到底是怎樣賺到這麼多錢的？

sentences.english: At forty every man is a fool or his own physician.
sentences.chinese: 人到四十，若非蠢材，當知調攝。

sentences.english: Shut up, Fool, you spin ain't genuine.
sentences.chinese: 閉嘴，你個蠢材，你那些小動作動機都不純。

definition: unable to accomplish anything but liable to spoil everything (idiom)/unable to do anything right/never make, but always mar
pinyin: cheng2 shi4 bu4 zu2 , bai4 shi4 you3 yu2

definition: wine sack, food bag (idiom); useless person, only fit for guzzling and boozing
to show no understanding of the times (idiom); cannot adapt to current circumstances/not amenable to reason
